meanings.definition: tootled: to move or travel in a leisurely or aimless manner
meanings.sent1: The little girl tootled along the path, stopping to pick flowers.
meanings.sent2: The cat tootled around the garden, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent3: The old man tootled through the park, enjoying the sunshine and fresh air.
meanings.sent4: The butterfly tootled from flower to flower, spreading joy with its colorful wings.
meanings.sent5: The stream tootled gently over the rocks, creating a soothing melody.

meanings.definition: tootled: made a series of short, high-pitched sounds, as a horn or whistle
meanings.sent1: The train tootled as it chugged along the tracks.
meanings.sent2: The car tootled its horn to alert the pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tootled on his toy trumpet, trying to play a tune.
meanings.sent4: The teapot tootled softly as it released steam.
meanings.sent5: The bird tootled a cheerful melody, welcoming the dawn.
